comment: Possibly the worst professor I've had. Spends whole class doing ONE problem WRONG, then posts a "corrected version" online. I've never had a professor say "I don't know" so much. Refuses to help with hw problems because he doesn't know how to do them. Literally spent an hour trying to solve one, couldn't figure it out until a student told him how.

Great guy that really loves what he does. Is very available outside of class and will go as in depth as possible with any questions you have. All of his tests are open book and he gives around 10 bonus points at the end of the semester. Downside is that the tests are very difficult since they are open book. Overall hard, but will learn a lot

Need help outside of class? You won't find it much with this professor. Want a response when you send out an email to your professor? Yeah me too; I didn't get it from this professor. Doesn't cover all the material so the final was way too hard. DEFINATELY recommend other professors.

I'm going to make it short and quick. Don't take this professor. Accent is heavy, not helpful after class, and is a strict grader. Doesn't even use a textbook so following along is difficult in itself.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Skip class? You won't pass.--GRADED BY FEW THINGS

comment: All I have to say is avoid. Doesn't know his stuff. Reads straight from book and uses notes from other professors. 2 tests only so if you start off bad then good luck! I regret taking him, better professors out there.

He has ABSOLUTELY NO SYMPATHY for students. 20 seconds late and he won't accept the assignment. He's picky in the way he wants answers. Tough grader. Exams are ridiculous. Does award extra credit. He has no true understanding of the material. Ask him an in depth question and he'll avoid it. Accent is heavy as well. All I have to say is good luck!

Professor Oncul was very easy to listen to. He always gives study outlines before tests. He records his lectures and posts them online. He posts his lecture notes online. He's always willing to answer questions. His accent doesn't impede your ability to understand him. If you come to class, pay attention, and do his assignments, you'll get an A.
He doesn't know the English language very well. Also he does his own positive ratings on here. I saw him give a $1 to everyone in his class to give him positive feedback on here.

I took him for ENGR 2214 over the summer in a 8 week term and he was a great professor! He utilizes technology very well and records all of his lectures using screen capture. He began using mastering engineering for the first time this semester. Everything was curved and I received an A in his class, however PRACTICE HELPS, review each section & HW

He was thrown in to teaching this section of Strength's Lab at the last second and you could kind of tell at first but overall it was fine. Graded the reports modestly, gave good feedback. The two Exams were a bit harder than anticipated.

This guy is an ideal professor. If you want to be a good engineer take Oncul. Participate, ask questions and do the work. To build skill you must have experience and practice solving problems. Lots of them.  He provides this. You'll thank him come time for FEEXAM. Switch to english or drop out if you do not think you need to  solve many problems.

BUSY WORK. Out of 14hr this 3 hr class was more work than the other 11hrs combined. Gave us 6 tests, like 12 lab reports, 5 HWs and 3 projects. Never had a class with near as much work. Inconsiderate and loves having authority over students. Oh yea and he had some other guy teach the class for half the semester while he sat in his office.

Dr. Oncul really does care. He tries hard to help every student understand. He has high standards, but you will learn the subject - and isn't that the point? I have him for 2 classes this semester & wish I could take more. You'll like him & he is very reasonable and understanding, if you are too! AND his jokes are funny if you're paying attention.

OMG...He makes a simple subject a nightmare...prepare for anything. He doesnt always seem like he knows what he is talking about, and is horrible at organizing the class material for tests, homework, labs and everything else...

I dont know what these other people had him for....but he made a 1 credit hr. excel class almost impossible.  And when you ask him for help, His famous line was, "figure it out."  I got a B but barely.

Awesome professor!  Attendence is counted toward your grade so you need to attend class.  Work load is manageable but you must work hard to do well.  Grading is fair and is willing to listen to the students.  He is good at returning emails and willing to help you with your questions.  I look forward to taking more of his classes.
